design_intent.player_goal: Build monitoring visibility (logs, flows, metadata) and run clean incident response: detect, analyze, contain, eradicate, recover, and improve.

trap_list.name: Event ≠ incident
trap_list.misconception: Every alert or log entry means you have an incident.
trap_list.fix: An event is any observable occurrence; an incident is when events represent a policy/security violation that requires response.

trap_list.name: Containment ≠ eradication
trap_list.misconception: Blocking C2 traffic means the system is clean.
trap_list.fix: Containment stops spread/damage; eradication removes artifacts (often via rebuild/restore).

trap_list.name: Tabletop ≠ simulation
trap_list.misconception: Any practice run is a simulation.
trap_list.fix: Tabletops are discussion-based; simulations are operational and must be clearly labeled to avoid real-world actions.

trap_list.name: Policy vs standard vs procedure
trap_list.fix: Policy sets intent; standards specify required controls; procedures are step-by-step implementation.

trap_list.name: Tuning ≠ turning off detection
trap_list.misconception: The fix for alert fatigue is to disable correlation or stop logging.
trap_list.fix: Tune thresholds/filters to reduce noise while preserving visibility and real detections.

trap_list.name: Flow ≠ packet capture
trap_list.misconception: NetFlow/sFlow gives you the same evidence as full packets.
trap_list.fix: Flow records summarize who/when/how much; packet capture provides payload-level detail.

trap_list.name: Linux auth logs: know the files
trap_list.misconception: All Linux distributions store auth logs in the same path.
trap_list.fix: Common auth/security logs include /var/log/auth.log and /var/log/secure; syslog message files vary by distro (/var/log/syslog vs /var/log/messages).

trap_list.name: Quarantine isn’t deletion
trap_list.fix: Quarantine isolates a file but still leaves it present for investigation; validate controls and monitor.

trap_list.name: Isolation vs segmentation
trap_list.misconception: Network segmentation and isolating a host are the same action.
trap_list.fix: Isolation removes a host from the network; segmentation is architectural separation that limits lateral movement across zones.

missions.name: Event or Incident?
missions.goal: Learn the incident response cycle and when an event becomes an incident.

mechanics.twist: You must decide fast: ignore, investigate, or declare incident.

missions.name: War Room Setup
missions.goal: Assemble the incident response team and the plans that keep humans coordinated.

missions.name: Hunt the Indicators
missions.goal: Recognize common IoCs and use them to drive detection and analysis.

mechanics.twist: Some indicators are decoys; watch the definitions.

missions.name: Adversary Map Room
missions.goal: Use common frameworks and monitoring categories to communicate what’s happening.

missions.name: Signal-to-Noise Fight Club
missions.goal: Work SIEM basics: correlation, dashboards, thresholds, alert tuning, and alert fatigue.

mechanics.twist: Too strict misses incidents; too loose burns analysts.

missions.name: Evidence Plumbing
missions.goal: Build reliable log and telemetry pipelines (syslog, journald, flows) and retention habits.

mechanics.twist: Sampling and retention constraints change outcomes.

boss.name: Boss: The Silent Flood
boss.premise: Alerts are screaming, logs are disappearing, and sensitive data may be leaking. Use monitoring data to declare the incident, contain it without blinding yourself, and pick mitigations that actually shrink the blast radius.

mechanics.phase_1: Triage noisy alerts and tune thresholds without turning visibility off.
mechanics.phase_2: Contain and isolate affected systems while preserving evidence (logs/metadata/flows).
mechanics.phase_3: Apply targeted mitigations (DLP/cert fixes/config changes) and plan automated response.

constraint_cards.name: Legal Hold
constraint_cards.effect: Retention must preserve evidence; deletion/quarantine choices have consequences.

constraint_cards.name: Storage Pressure
constraint_cards.effect: High log volume forces prioritization and smarter filters.

constraint_cards.name: Distributed Cloud Footprint
constraint_cards.effect: Some data only exists in remote regions; deploy sensors/agents wisely.

modes.name: Triage Duel
modes.description: Race to classify events, spot IoCs, and declare the incident at the right time.

modes.name: Containment Chess
modes.description: Pick mitigations that contain damage without destroying evidence or visibility.

options.A: An event is any observable occurrence; an incident is a violation of policy/procedure or security practice.
